Class Rectangle

java.lang.Object
  GeometricShape
      Polygon
          Rectangle
All Implemented Interfaces:
AnotherComparable, Comparable, Nearable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Square
public class Rectangle
extends Polygon

Rectangle is a four-sided Polygon that has a width and a length. It can calculate its area and perimeter. Its compareTo method compares the length and width of two Rectangles.

Version:
October 26, 2016
Author:
Alex Yu

Method Detail

compareTo

public int compareTo(Object obj)
Compares the current Rectangle obj with the Object obj using their lengths and widths.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface Comparable
Specified by:
compareTo in class GeometricShape
Parameters:
obj - the Rectangle object to compare
Returns:
0 if the two Rectangles have the same lengths and widths within an EPSILON, which is defined within GeometricShape > 0 if "this" length or width is greater than the other Rectangle's < 0 if "this" length or width is less than the other Rectangle's -999 if obj is not a Rectangle

equals

public boolean equals(Object obj)
Tests to see if two Rectangles have the same lengths and widths within an EPSILON, which is defined in GeometricShape.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
obj - the Rectangle obj to compare
Returns:
true if the two Rectangles have "nearly equal" lengths and widths; otherwise, false

toString

public String toString()
Formats the class name, the Rectangle's name, area, perimeter, as well as its width and length. In addition, it includes whether "this" Rectangle is regular and how many sides it has.

Overrides:
toString in class GeometricShape
Returns:
a formatted line about "this" Rectangle
